definition: harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
accord/to make contact/to agree/to consult with/extensive

sentences.english: The minute she is hooked youwant to break rapport.
sentences.chinese: 她迷上你的那一刻就會想打破融洽。

sentences.english: Do you click well with your colleagues and boss?
sentences.chinese: 你和同事上司相處得融洽嗎？

sentences.english: In the opinion of some lofty experts they never quite cohered again.
sentences.chinese: 在某些玄虛的專家看來，他們沒有再完全融洽統一過。

sentences.english: I have a good relationship with the Juve public.
sentences.chinese: 而我和尤文蒂尼的關係一直都很融洽。

sentences.english: Things for the Chinese people and selfless advocate, it is interpersonal harmony.
sentences.chinese: 中國人崇尚天下爲公和心底無私，故人際關係融洽。

sentences.english: My bridesmaids just cannot get along.
sentences.chinese: 我的伴娘們就是不能融洽地相處。

sentences.english: The matey relation between the doctors and patients has active effect on preventing medical disputes.
sentences.chinese: 融洽的醫患關係對防範醫療糾紛起着積極的作用。

sentences.english: We sympathized with each other when we lived in  Europe.
sentences.chinese: 在歐洲居住期間，我們之間的關係十分融洽。

sentences.english: Their partnership gelled and scriptwriting for television followed.
sentences.chinese: 他們的合作關係融洽，接着又一起爲電視劇寫劇本。

sentences.english: We share everything between and relate well to each other regardless of chinchin or ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 我們不分彼此，相處融洽，不必拘泥客套禮節。

sentences.english: In some cases, the relationship might go downhill after having spent a couple of blissful years together.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，融洽生活多年的夫婦也會勞燕分飛。

sentences.english: This is a harmony between man and nature Rongcheng fishing village.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個人與自然和諧融洽的榮成漁村。

sentences.english: This neutral-rapport process lasts for a minute or two at most.
sentences.chinese: 這個中性的融洽過程要保持1分鐘或者最多兩分鐘。

sentences.english: An interviewer hosts the meeting in an office setting where a friendly conversation takes place between two people.
sentences.chinese: 在一間辦公室裏，面試官和應聘者進行融洽的交流。

sentences.english: His tastes were in harmony with hers, which brought them into harmony.
sentences.chinese: 他的愛好同她的愛好協調，這使得他們很融洽。

sentences.english: If it is in a harmonious communication atmo here, which can bring pleasure to the two sides.
sentences.chinese: 如果交際氛圍融洽，會帶來交際雙方的愉悅。

definition: peaceful relations/harmonious
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
intimate/close
(of relations) joyous and harmonious
intimate/to get close to
cheerful/cheerily/delightful/pleasant/pleasantly/pleasing/happy/delighted

familiar/close
to live in harmony/to get along with each other
family-like close relationship (idiom)

tacit understanding/mutual understanding/rapport/connected at a deep level with each other/(of team members) well coordinated/tight

friendly/amicable/close friend
amiable/easy-going
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
